books.description: The 21st book in the Pendergast series. Constance Greene travels back in time to prevent the deaths of her siblings. Read by Jefferson Mays. 14 hours, 24 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE CABINET OF DR. LENG

books.author: Prince Harry
books.description: The Duke of Sussex details his struggles with the royal family, loss of his mother, service in the British Army and marriage to Meghan Markle. Read by the author. 15 hours, 39 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SPARE

books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady shares personal stories and the tools she uses to deal with difficult situations. Read by the author. 10 hours unabridged.
books.title: THE LIGHT WE CARRY

books.author: Jennette McCurdy
books.description: The actress and filmmaker describes her eating disorders and difficult relationship with her mother. Read by the author. 6 hours, 25 minutes unabridged.
books.title: I'M GLAD MY MOM DIED

books.author: Matthew Perry
books.description: The actor, known for playing Chandler Bing on “Friends,” shares stories from his childhood and his struggles with sobriety. Read by the author. 8 hours, 49 minutes unabridged.
books.title: FRIENDS, LOVERS, AND THE BIG TERRIBLE THING

books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery. Read by Sean Pratt. 16 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: Peter Zeihan
books.description: A look at potential changes in globalization. Read by the author. 16 hours, 44 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE END OF THE WORLD IS JUST THE BEGINNING

books.author: Stephen A. Smith
books.description: The ESPN analyst recounts the highs and lows of his life and career. Read by the author. 7 hours, 55 minutes unabridged.
books.title: STRAIGHT SHOOTER

books.author: Viola Davis
books.description: The multiple award-winning actress describes the difficulties she encountered before claiming her sense of self and achieving professional success. Read by the author. 9 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: FINDING ME

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species. Read by Derek Perkins. 15 hours, 17 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SAPIENS

books.author: Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.contributor: by Bruce D. Perry and Oprah Winfrey
books.description: An approach to dealing with trauma that shifts an essential question used to investigate it. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 27 minutes unabridged.
books.title: WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU?

books.author: Bono
books.description: The lead singer of the Irish rock band U2 offers details of his life, career and activism. Read by the author. 20 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: SURRENDER

books.author: Brad Meltzer and Josh Mensch
books.contributor: by Brad Meltzer and Josh Mensch
books.description: The story of a Nazi plot to kill President Roosevelt, Joseph Stalin and Winston Churchill. Read by Scott Brick. 10 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE NAZI CONSPIRACY

books.author: Gabor Maté with Daniel Maté
books.contributor: by Gabor Maté with Daniel Maté
books.description: The potential ways in which trauma and stress from modern-day living can affect our physical health. Read by Daniel Maté. 18 hours, 13 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE MYTH OF NORMAL

books.description: A master spy must pass himself off as a family man to infiltrate a private school, but his new wife is an assassin and adopted child is a telepath.

books.description: If devil hunters don’t agree to a deal, Denji may need to carve up everything in his way.
books.title: CHAINSAW MAN, VOL. 3

books.description: The second book in the Heartstopper series. Nick discovers things about the people around him, and about himself.

books.description: The action moves to an underground fight club where a suspended third-year student at Jujutsu High works as a bookie.

books.description: A new assistant seeks to shake things up at a boutique literary and talent agency where damaging secrets have been kept hidden.

books.description: The 55th book of the In Death series. Eve Dallas is reminded of her past as she investigates a possible sex trafficking ring.

books.description: Aloysius Archer, a World War II veteran, seeks to apprentice with Willie Dash, a private eye, in a corrupt California town.

books.description: The 11th book in the Jack Reacher series. Reacher must discover who is hunting members of a team of former military investigators.
